page.title: 04TURNSHAWS SPECIAL SCHOOL
page.content: We are from the Special School. The headteacher is Miss Simpson. There are 53 children, 6 teachers and 6 helpers in our school. We have 4 classes, a Special Care Unit and a Nursery. We do lots of things like numbers, reading, writing, computer and drawing. We also go horse-riding, swimming, hiking, camping, go on trips such as barge holiday and to the seaside. Many children visit other schools such as D.A.B.T.A.C. Shelley High School and Kirkburton Middle School.We call this link work. We have a garden and the leavers class grow vegetables and flowers. We have a youth club, here we play games such as snooker, there is a disco and we have pop and crisps. Turnshaws School is a very happy and friendly place, with nice teachers and helpers.
